definitions: To be converted into ice or another solid as a result of extreme cold.
To become blocked or inoperable because of the formation of ice.
To hold (prices, wages, or accounts) at a particular level or in a particular state for a period.
examples: The water freezes solid in winter.
The computer freezes when I open that program.
The government freezes assets of the sanctioned individuals.
He freezes in fear when he sees a spider.
